tags: my baby girl getting the recognition she deserves
summary: Me, last week: Arya isn’t really getting the recognition she deserves and I’m afraid that this season is going to be like last...
body:
Me, last week: Arya isn’t really getting the recognition she deserves and I’m afraid that this season is going to be like last season in terms of her characterization.

EW: *releases promo photos with Arya looking like a fucking goddess*

HBO: *releases the trailer which includes focus on Arya for the first bit and a really badass narration*

Me today: lmao never MIND

summary: It’s been confirmed that Bran is going to be much less robotic this season, Arya is going have a conflict between her drive to...
body: It’s been confirmed that Bran is going to be much less robotic this season, Arya is going have a conflict between her drive to murder everyone who did her family wrong and her humanness (she will choose her humanness) and that Sansa is going to becoming a leader in her own rights. House Stark is finally going to be done right this season, and we’re going to get everything we deserve and so much more. I’m so glad that the writers finally realized that house Stark matters because I was tired of seeing them be mistreated, dehumanized and relocated to the side by the writers.

blog.name: hopelesstvaddict
blog.title: worry about the past. the future can wait.
blog.description:
No need to know the nAme. 
Swoon and marvel at simple things.
LOST defined life. Live in the Enchanted Forest. Love what happens in Westeros. Wish you could hang out in Rosewood with some pretty little liars. Agonize over the events in Beacon Hills. And so on. Unconditional Cut & Run, Titanic and LOTR lover. 
Proud Princess Aurora, Sansa Stark and Alison Dilaurentis supporter.

summary: Character placements during the Battle for the Dawn
body:
Character placements during the Battle for the Dawn

Ok now that we have actual footage of the Battle for the Dawn, let’s place everyone during this Long Night that will kill us all (and many of them)

Characters seen fighting during the Battle :

  • Arya (halls and courtyard)
  • Jon (courtyard)
  • Jaime (ramparts/battlements)
  • Brienne (open field and ramparts/battlements)
  • Pod (open field and ramparts/battlements)
  • Jorah (open field)
  • Greyworm (likely off to open field)
  • Davos (ramparts)

Characters seen elsewhere during the Battle :

  • Varys (in the crypts)
  • Gilly (in the crypts)
  • Missandei (kissing Greyworm goodbye)
  • Sandor

Characters with unknown whereabouts during the Battle :

  • Sansa
  • Daenerys
  • Tyrion
  • Bran
  • Sam (but known at some point to wield a sword)
  • Drogon and Rhaegal

Characters whose participation is unsure :

  • Edd
  • Tormund
  • Beric
  • Theon
  • Gendry

The focus was clearly on the action as the warriors were all showcased. Analyzing the sequencing, we can conclude that after the first part of the battle outside the walls of Winterfell, the characters will retreat on the ramparts/battlements and the courtyard - meaning Jaime, Pod and Brienne survive the first wave. Jorah and Greyworm on the other hand, the show clearly leaves their fates in the balance.

And for other characters - Sansa, Bran, Dany - however, the secret is still not out as to where they can be and what they will be doing during the battle. Begs the question whether that’s deliberately not shown because they are involved in important stuff of their own… Sansa may not be involved in the fighting itself but she will definitely have been participating in the strategy of defense. Tyrion maybe as well. And Bran and Dany have their role to play against the Night King…

tags: gosh my inbox is such a sigh rn
summary: Sansa loves Jon. She has never and will never think of him as only anything. Especially half brother. You do know they are not...
question: Sansa loves Jon. She has never and will never think of him as only anything. Especially half brother. You do know they are not really siblings but cousins? How dare you make up such shitty lies about Sansa.
answer:
Sansa would beg to differ.

“He’s our brother,” Arya said, much too loudly. Her voice cut through the afternoon quiet of the tower room.          
Septa Mordane raised her eyes. She had a bony face, sharp eyes, and a thin lipless mouth made for frowning. It was frowning now. “What are you talking about, children?”
“Our half brother,” Sansa corrected, soft and precise.

She had not thought of Jon in ages. He was only her half brother, but still … with Robb and Bran and Rickon dead, Jon Snow was the only brother that remained to her.

Sansa literally corrects Arya when Arya says that Jon is their brother. Her thoughts of Jon always include the differentiation of him being her half brother or bastard brother.

“There was a black brother,” Sansa said, “begging men for the Wall, only he was kind of old and smelly.” She hadn’t liked that at all. She had always imagined the Night’s Watch to be men like Uncle Benjen. In the songs, they were called the black knights of the Wall. But this man had been crookbacked and hideous, and he looked as though he might have lice. If this was what the Night’s Watch was truly like, she felt sorry for her bastard half brother, Jon.

She sang for mercy, for the living and the dead alike, for Bran and Rickon and Robb, for her sister Arya and her bastard brother Jon Snow, away off on the Wall.

Sansa could never understand how two sisters, born only two years apart, could be so different. It would have been easier if Arya had been a bastard, like their half brother Jon. She even looked like Jon, with the long face and brown hair of the Starks, and nothing of their lady mother in her face or her coloring. And Jon’s mother had been common, or so people whispered. Once, when she was littler, Sansa had even asked Mother if perhaps there hadn’t been some mistake. Perhaps the grumkins had stolen her real sister. But Mother had only laughed and said no, Arya was her daughter and Sansa’s trueborn sister, blood of their blood. Sansa could not think why Mother would want to lie about it, so she supposed it had to be true.

Note the assertion here that Arya was Sansa’s trueborn sister, blood of their blood. It implies that there is a difference in proximity between a trueborn sibling and a bastard sibling. Sansa goes on to think that it would be easier if Arya was a bastrad like Jon because of that exact sentiment since it is expected for there to be a distance between trueborn and bastard siblings.

Also, Sansa does not know that Jon is her cousin so that has no bearing on how she refers to him, hence the half brother part. That does not mean that I think that Sansa hates Jon or any such nonsense, only that she sees him in a different way from how she sees the rest of her siblings, specifically because he is a bastard.

In short, please do reread the books before you go off in people’s inbox about their so-called lies. Or, if you’re a show-only watcher, perhaps rewatch the scene where Sansa says that she was horrible to Jon as a child and asks him to forgive her.

blog.name: liloproductions
blog.title: Lilo Productions
blog.description: I'm Lilo, Audio Engineer focus on Postproduction for tv and films. I love music!! Obsessed with tv shows, currently Once Upon A Time (Mostly CS), Supergirl, GoT, The Flash, Arrow and more... summary: Either this is just Arya dreaming or she is really scared this time... I’ve been trying to think what would make Arya terrified,...
body:
Either this is just Arya dreaming or she is really scared this time…

I’ve been trying to think what would make Arya terrified, worried and in tears like that and…. this kidnapping plot of Sansa is getting more and more plausible by the minute. I have a feeling Sansa will be kidnapped by another Faceless Man or Woman and Arya got hurt trying to rescue Sansa and stop the Faceless Woman from kidnapping Sansa but was unsuccessful. And this is her reaction when she woke up and Sansa was gone. She had a bloody face on her right cheek so it could be that she was knocked unconscious.  I could be wrong but I feel that is the only way Arya will be shook like this. If Sansa, Bran or Jon’s life is in danger…

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: “Nymeria nipped eagerly at her hand as Arya untied her. She had yellow eyes. When they caught the sunlight, they gleamed like...
body:
“Nymeria nipped eagerly at her hand as Arya untied her. She had yellow eyes. When they caught the sunlight, they gleamed like two golden coins. Arya had named her after the warrior queen of the Rhoyne, who had led her people across the narrow sea. That had been a great scandal too. Sansa, of course, had named her pup “Lady.” Arya made a face and hugged the wolfling tight. Nymeria licked her ear, and she giggled.” - Arya I, AGoT

Whats the scandal? That Nymeria led her people across the narrow sea or that Arya named her pup after a dornish warrior queen? Both?
